text: The Radio Times is a magazine that used to be published by the BBC once a week. It has lists of radio and TV programs, interviews, and reviews. It was started in May 1923 by John Reith. It was the world's first broadcast listings magazine. Since 1991 it has had details of other broadcasts, not just from the BBC. Radio Times was the magazine with the largest circulation in Europe in 1955, with an average sale of 8.8 million. Since 2011 it has been published by the Immediate Media Company. ==References== Category:BBC Category:British weekly magazines Category:1923 establishments in England
title: Radio Times
